text: From tap at Bøker & Børst with BHK 21.04.16. Clear pale golden. Aroma pf papaya and wine gum. Similar taste. Bitterness and astringency of artificial sweeteners in aftertaste. Soma pale malt sweetness.

Tap @ Growler Guys. Light golden color with a little white head. Aroma of citrus and light pine, some pilsener malt. Flavor is modest bitters and mild sweet. Pine and spruce, good balance between that and the pilsener malt. Top of the style for sure.
On tap slightly hazy pale light golden nice full white head. Plenty of noble hop bite. Classic very light pale pils malt. Clean and refreshing.
Not too bad. Nothing to write home about. Some tame hops buoyed by a foundation of light malt.

On tap at Både&. A hazy golden beer with a minimal sized off-white head. Nutty malts, a herbal and grassy touch and some pine cones in the aroma. Grapefruit notes. Solid but not overwhelming malt flavor with pineapple, pine cones, resins and a faint grassy touch. Full body and a nice carbonation level. Nice bitterness. Long finish with hops dominating. A pleasant, easy drinkable and tasteful beer. 160109
Lovely white crest of foam. A lightly soapy aroma, some lemon in there. Smooth a tickle of sweet, some nice citrus. It definitely has a distinctly soapy thing going on. Its crisp though.

On tap at breakside pub Portland. Pours out golden topped with a white head. Nose is pine citrus hops some bread malts and orange zest. Taste is more of the pine orange and grapefruit hops along with a little malty sweetness to keep the balance.

On tap at the Breakside Portland, OR brewery at the RBSG 2015. Pours clear yellow with a white head. Nose of pine and floral hops. Medium in body with a very smooth clean mouth feel. The flavor is pine hops and the finish is lightly bitter. Very good and easy drinking.

Draft sample. Aroma impression is fruit cocktail, pineapple juice, grapefruit, yeast, faint resin, banana, malt seemingly transparent in flavor and aroma. Medium-light bodied, sweet, syrupy and a bit goopy in the mouth with strong finishing bitterness and a nagging silt / grit quality. I like that they say equal parts Classic European and West Coast America, because this is pretty much nothing like classic European lagers, and everything like a hoppy, sugary western IPA.

Lukt: Frukter, hvete og malt.
Utseende: Gyllen honning farge.
Skum/kullsyre: Dekkende skum, heng langs kant.
Smak: Frukig, humle og malt. Smaken av frukter sitter.

On tap @ the brewery in Portland, RBSG. Bright gold, thick white head. Foresty hop profile, piney and earthy but very fresh with only light bitterness. Fantastic lager!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: On tap @ Breakside. Clear yellow pour with a white head. Lots of orange and grapefruit peel aromas. Slightly grassy, plenty of floral notes, and some pine. Pretty dry and crisp beer and flavor. Good piney bitterness and plenty of citrus flavor, particularly orange. Slightly herbal, too. Solid beer.
Draft - Lots of pine and a touch of skunk. Clear gold with a rich white head. Lots of piney hops with a nice mellow finish. No bitterness and easy drinking.

On tap at Breakside Milwaukee, pours a clear golden blonde with a medium white head. Aroma brings out loads of piney hops and a big foresty quality. Flavour is very hoppy without the astringency, with piney hops and woody notes. So damn clean without any astringency. Great stuff.
On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with small frothy white head. The aroma is tropical fruit and pine. Thin mouth, juicy fruit hop, pineapple, light bitterness, really nice.

Draught at Alibi Room, VancouverAmber color, clean. Buttery aroma, fudge. Good body strength, with some residual sugars, some caramel flavor, and a massive amount of diacetyl, more than most other infected beers I had, and unfortunately undrinkable even for somebody tolerant like me.Undrinkable.

Breakside Douglas Fir Lager on tap at Lingua. It pours a brilliantly clear deep gold. The nose is peppery, bready, slightly sweet & mildly hopped. A promising start to this lager. Medium bodied with a soft round carbonation and a crisp finish. The taste is really interesting, earthy, peppery, a bit of Apple/jolly rancher in the aftertaste... isnt that an off flavor? Dry wheaty biscuits, mulch like earthiness that evokes a forest plus some spicy character. Pretty good.

Bomber. Pours a bright orange color with a small white head. A big fruit, pine nose. The flavor is sweet, huge pine, citrus, super clean. I think this is really a IPL. PIls malt, clean big fruity hops, marmalade tea. Wanna buy a keg, wanna do a keg stand: I do. Do it with this. Lovely. Soft.
